intro: Chassalia subnuda, commonly known as the naked chassalia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, upright stems and narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. Chassalia subnuda is often found in grasslands and along roadsides, thriving in full sun and well-drained soils.
